alert.note: Alert for Lower Jefferson; St. Charles; St. John The Baptist; Upper Jefferson; Western Orleans (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 15 at 12:37PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central St. John The Baptist, northern St. Charles, west central Orleans and northwestern Jefferson Parishes through 115 PM CDT... At 1237 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Reserve, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... New Orleans, Reserve, Avondale, Metairie, Hahnville, Laplace, Jefferson, Harahan, Westwego, Montz, Luling, Garyville, River Ridge, Boutte, Ama, Destrehan, St. Rose, Killona, Norco and Elmwood. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 199 and 233. Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 5. Interstate 310 between mile markers 1 and 11. Interstate 610 between mile markers 1 and 3. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 PM CDT for southeastern Louisiana.

area.areaDesc: Lower Jefferson; St. Charles; St. John The Baptist; Upper Jefferson; Western Orleans
